selection_reasoning: Trial 3_0 is extremely close to the best-known solution. I am carrying it forward for high-precision parameter tuning (radius bounds, step sizes, and sampling density). I am also retaining the Compression (3_6) and Nested LP (2_8) strategies to maintain algorithmic diversity.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score (2.6319). It successfully combined Halton-sequence greedy initialization with an intensive Basin Hopping search. It is the strongest candidate for final convergence.
A strong alternative approach (2.575) using a 'Shrinking Boundaries' (Compression) cycle. This diversity is important if the greedy-start Basin Hopping approach plateaus.

The 'Nested LP' approach. Although it struggled in Gen 3 due to infeasibility issues, the mathematical principle of using LP for radii is sound. Refinement of the center-movement logic could make it a winner.
